articles.headline: Johnson & Johnson Recalls Hip Implants
articles.snippet: It was the latest in a succession of recalls of some of the company’s best-selling products.
articles.abstract: It was the latest in a succession of recalls of some of the company’s best-selling products.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than two years after the Food and Drug Administration began receiving complaints about the failure of a hip replacement implant made by the DePuy Orthopaedics unit of Johnson & Johnson, the company said Thursday that it was recalling two kinds of hip implants.

articles.headline: Heart of Iowa as Fault Line of Egg Recall
articles.snippet: Some say disease is another reason to detest industrial-size farms, while others see them as an economic savior.
articles.abstract: Some say disease is another reason to detest industrial-size farms, while others see them as an economic savior.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLARION, Iowa  The scrambled eggs, as always, were hissing in a skillet on a recent morning at a coffee shop here, in an egg-producing county that has suddenly found itself at the center of the nation’s egg recall over salmonella. But the conversation at the weekly gathering of local ladies turned uncharacteristically tense.

articles.headline: Wind Turbine Projects Run Into Resistance
articles.snippet: Goals clash as the Defense Department raises concerns that wind projects can interfere with radar operations.
articles.abstract: Goals clash as the Defense Department raises concerns that wind projects can interfere with radar operations.
articles.lead_paragraph: BARSTOW, Calif.  The United States military has found a new menace hiding here in the vast emptiness of the Mojave Desert in California: wind turbines.

articles.headline: Charges Settled Over Fake Reviews on iTunes
articles.snippet: A marketer had faced deceptive advertising charges over positive reviews of games in the Apple iTunes store.
articles.abstract: A marketer had faced deceptive advertising charges over positive reviews of games in the Apple iTunes store.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Discerning Internet users know that glowing online reviews of things like books or restaurants cannot always be trusted. But federal regulators are serving notice that if you stand to gain financially from the review you are writing, you should be upfront about it.

articles.headline: Acrimony Behind the Scenes of Gulf Oil Spill
articles.snippet: New information suggests that the process of killing the failed well was far more stressful than the public knew.
articles.abstract: New information suggests that the process of killing the failed well was far more stressful than the public knew.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by  Clifford Krauss, Henry Fountain and John M. Broder.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss, Henry Fountain and John M. Broder

articles.headline: Facing Long Mine Rescue, Chile Spares No Expense
articles.snippet: President Sebastián Piñera has staked his nascent presidency on rescuing the miners, sparing no attempted innovation to maintain their psychological health.
articles.abstract: President Sebastián Piñera has staked his nascent presidency on rescuing the miners, sparing no attempted innovation to maintain their psychological health.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSÉ MINE, Chile  The government has consulted NASA about the extreme isolation of space. Chilean Navy officers have come to discuss the emotional stress of living in a submarine. Doctors stand at the ready with antidepressants. Even a tiny home theater is being funneled down in plastic tubes to occupy the 33 miners stuck in their subterranean home.

articles.headline: A Big Surprise: Troubled Assets Garner Rewards
articles.snippet: The program devised to purge troubled real estate assets from the financial system has generated an estimated return of 15.5 percent for taxpayers so far.
articles.abstract: The program devised to purge troubled real estate assets from the financial system has generated an estimated return of 15.5 percent for taxpayers so far.
articles.lead_paragraph: American taxpayers are already poised to make unexpected billions from rescuing the nation’s banks. Now, they could reap another sizable profit from a government program devised to purge troubled real estate assets from the financial system.

articles.headline: Pakistan Flood Sets Back Infrastructure by Years
articles.snippet: The destruction of roads, schools and health clinics could further weaken the civilian administration.
articles.abstract: The destruction of roads, schools and health clinics could further weaken the civilian administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: SUKKUR, Pakistan  Men waded waist deep all week wedging stones with their bare hands into an embankment to hold back Pakistan’s surging floodwaters. It was a rudimentary and ultimately vain effort to save their town. On Thursday, the waters breached the levee, a demoralizing show of how fragile Pakistan’s infrastructure remains, and how overwhelming the task is to save it.

articles.headline: USA Today to Remake Itself to Stress Digital Operations
articles.snippet: The changes would de-emphasize the print edition and increase efforts to reach more readers and advertisers through mobile devices.
articles.abstract: The changes would de-emphasize the print edition and increase efforts to reach more readers and advertisers through mobile devices.
articles.lead_paragraph: The history of USA Today is full of firsts for the newspaper business: the first general-interest national paper of its kind, the first to use color widely in charts and photographs and once first in the number of copies printed each day.

articles.headline: Fed Ready to Dig Deeper to Aid Growth, Chief Says
articles.snippet: Ben S. Bernanke signaled that the Fed was prepared to take several steps if the economy continued to weaken.
articles.abstract: Ben S. Bernanke signaled that the Fed was prepared to take several steps if the economy continued to weaken.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSON HOLE, Wyo.  The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, signaled once again on Friday that the central bank was prepared to act if the economy continued to weaken, as yet another economic report confirmed that the recovery had slowed to a crawl.
